results.title: Loose Change
results.brief_description: ‘Loose Change’ is a short animated film about money and demonstrates what you can do with money. The film has various coins and dollars talking and discussing what it is like being money.
results.description: ‘Loose Change’ is a short animated film about money and demonstrates what you can do with money. The film has various coins and dollars talking and discussing what it is like being money.

results.title: Loops to learn by
results.creator_credit: Rex Tasker, Robert Verrall, Dorothy Courtois and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: One of the most practical and productive of innovations in educational visual aids was the 8mm single-concept film loop contained in a cassette inserted into a projector simple enough for a young child to operate. This film tells how a series of such loops for people with learning disabilities were developed with the advice of psychologists, and shows situations in which they can be usefully employed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rex Tasker, Robert Verrall, Dorothy Courtois and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Loops = Boucles
results.brief_description: An experimental film in which percussive rhythm is integrated with simple geometric abstractions, both visuals and sound being created by the artist, Norman McLaren. Visuals and sounds are drawn by hand directly on raw film with ordinary pen and ink. Neither camera nor sound recording equipment has been used in the making of this film.

results.title: Looper
results.creator_credit: Ram Bergman Productions, Endgame Entertainment, DMG Entertainment, FilmDistrict, Ed Verreaux, Sharen Davis, James D. Stern, Rian Johnson and Ram Bergman
results.headline_credit: China and United States of America, 2012
results.brief_description: In the futuristic action thriller Looper, time travel will be invented but it will be illegal and only available on the black market, where the mob uses it to send hitmen into the past to assassinate targets.

constellations_other.name: Obviously the time continuum has been disrupted...again and again and again!
constellations_other.description: Eadweard Muybridge was able to capture time and play it back again creating endless time paradoxes where subjects are destined to repeat their previous actions. Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ram Bergman Productions, Endgame Entertainment, DMG Entertainment, FilmDistrict, Ed Verreaux, Sharen Davis, James D. Stern, Rian Johnson and Ram Bergman
results.description: In the futuristic action thriller Looper, time travel will be invented but it will be illegal and only available on the black market. When the mob wants to get rid of someone, they will send their target 30 years into the past where a looper, a hired gun, like Joe is waiting to mop up. Joe is getting rich and life is good until the day the mob decides to close the loop, sending back Joe’s future self for assassination.
description_for_label: In the futuristic action thriller Looper, time travel will be invented but it will be illegal and only available on the black market. When the mob wants to get rid of someone, they will send their target 30 years into the past where a looper, a hired gun, like Joe is waiting to mop up. Joe is getting rich and life is good until the day the mob decides to close the loop, sending back Joe’s future self for assassination.

results.title: Loop
results.brief_description: A documentary about Melbourne’s Underground Rail Loop, its effect on the entire metropolitan railway system, and on the future of public transport in Melbourne. Shows the route the loop tracks and tunnels will follow around the city, the sites for the three new underground stations to supplement the present two stations, how passengers will travel from suburban stations when the loop is operating, how the loop is being constructed, and the benefits for train travellers of having five city stations close to shops, theatres and offices. Photographed by Volk Mol, sound by Don Boardman, edited by Geoff Wright, narrated by Michael Pate. Produced for the Melbourne Underground Rail Loop Authority.

results.title: Loop
results.creator_credit: Maciej Wszelaki, Hugh Burton and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: Shot in black and white and with no dialogue (one word is spoken), just sound effects (most notably textile machinery), this non-linear short is about grieving, loss and infidelity. A phone call in the middle of the night triggers a chain of events in pregnant young Judy who accidentally discovers her dead husband was having an affair with a woman from work. Cast: Donna McRae, Dino Marnika (Awards: Winner of numerous awards, including editing and sound awards at VCA School of Film and Television Awards, 1993)

results.title: Loony Tom: the happy lover
results.brief_description: ‘Loony Tom’ is a mixture of “plein-air” ballet and the old silent slapstick comedies - with the sole exception that here the hero is so devoted to his single-minded pursuit of the eternal feminine that he has no time for the violent “gags” that liberally puntuated the Sennet pictures. This film will be relished as a pure comedy, but those who are familiar with James Broughton’s other works will quickly perceive its poetic overtones and philosophic implications. Kermit Sheets mimes the title role; Ralph Gilbert composed and plays the piano accompaniment.

results.title: Looks and smiles
results.creator_credit: Ken Loach, Irving Teitelbaum, Kestrel Films (Australia) and Black Lion Films
results.brief_description: This film by Ken Loach, the Director of “Cathy come home”, “Family life and “Kes”, takes a bleak but compassionate look at working-class life in contemporary Britain. It is set in Industrialized Sheffield and while not an attack on the system, the film implicity condemns the system’s failure to cope with economic fluctuations. Script by Barry Hines.

results.title: Looking up down under
results.creator_credit: Michael Hollander, ABC-TV (Australia), Open Learning Agency of Australia and Monash University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Astronomy: an Open Learning unit”.
Telescopes provide our gateway to the stars. The study of astronomy relies heavily on telescopes and has done so for many centuries. Australia is in a unique position for studying the heavens, given its location in the Southern Hemisphere and its relatively small population. This program looks at the history of Astronomy in Australia.
